page.title: 17THE BLOOD STAINED STEPS
page.content: During the Civil War some Roundheads came to Kirkburton to take the Vicar, Gamaliel Whitaker to Manchester because he was a Royalist. They searched the vicarage for him. They found him and searched the house again for anyone else including Hester Whitaker, the vicars wife, but didn't find anyone. As they were taking Mr Whitaker away, a boy thought he heard something behind him. He thought that if he shot whatever it was he may be praised as a hero. He spun round and pulled the trigger. There was a flash, bang and a dead woman lying on the vicarage steps with blood pouring from her head. It was Hester, Gamaliels wife. People say that blood can still be seen on the steps. In 1954 when the vicarage was altered, human bones were found and taken to Leeds. They were identified as female bones.
